page.title: 20WILD FLOWERS AROUND ROXWELL
page.content:
More wild flowers can be seen along the edges of the road as these are not trimmed so often. In the early summer the cow parsley grows to a height of about one metre.Later on Dog Roses cover parts of the hedges making a colourful display. The Campion is another common wild flower, with Shepherd's Purse, Poppy, Mayweed, Thistles, Speedwell, Goosegrass, and Hedge Mustard. Towards the end of summer Rose-Bay Willowherb is seen along the sides of the road.
The common trees in the area are the {OAK, HAWTHORN, HORSE CHESTNUT, {WILLOW, ASH}and{FIELD MAPLE}in the hedges. Dutch Elm Disease has killed many trees. Some farmers are planting young trees to replace others.
